goal.summary: Your goal is to maximise the score in 2050. Your score is calculated as the weighted average of the economic, social, and environmental scores, which can be seen below.
goal.title: Goal

2019.intro:
In this game, you are assigned some economic, environmental and social preferences.

Your mission is simple: make climate policy choices in 2020, 2030, and 2040 to maximize the score for your assigned point of view in 2050.

Your solution is compared to the optimal score calculated by the Open Source Energy Modelling System for Europe (OSeMBE).

2020.intro:
In order to maximize your score in 2050, you are now asked for some climate policy choices.

Remember that you need to take your assigned point of view into account when making your choices.
2020.researchDecision: Should there be extra financial incentives for research and development of renewable/carbon free technologies?
2020.emissionsDecision: Which restrictions are you willing to set in order to reach your emission target?

2030.transmissionDecision: Do you want to implement the 10-year network development plan on transboundary grid capacity?

options.lowReduction: Low reduction rate – EU ETS cap
options.mediumReduction: Medium reduction rate - IPPC Pathway Zero Emissions in 2050
options.highReduction: High reduction rate - Zero emissions in 2040

decisions.keepEmission: Do you want to keep your emission reduction rate for the next 10 years or change it?
decisions.yourPOW: Your assigned point of view in this game

score.intro-2: Your decisions are measured against the optimal decisions for your assigned point of view.

euAcknowledgement: This project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 691739.

share.shareDialogText: Share the following link to let others try the game:
share.intro: The goal of the game is to maximise the score in 2050. The score is calculated as the weighted average of the economic, social, and environmental scores.

startmodal.title: Your point of view
startmodal.intro: The pie chart below illustrates your point of view. The largest slice of the pie is your main priority.
startmodal.details:
You impact each of these three components with your decisions in 2020, 2030, and 2040. You are measured by the result in 2050 as follows:

- Economic: Higher Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in 2050 is better
- Social: Cheaper access to energy for everyone in 2050 is better
- Environmental: Lower annual CO2 emissions in 2050 are better
